prompt: Write a technical overview of the discretization framework in OpenFOAM, covering spatial and temporal schemes, the fvSchemes dictionary structure, and how users configure gradient, divergence, Laplacian, interpolation, and surface normal gradient schemes.
expected_sections: Interpolation and Surface Normal Gradient Schemes
must_include_facts: fvSchemes is located in the system directory of an OpenFOAM case
ddtSchemes sub-dictionary controls time derivative discretization
steadyState keyword disables time derivative terms
Gauss integration is the standard method for divergence and Laplacian schemes
cellLimited keyword applies a gradient limiter to prevent overshoots
snGradSchemes controls surface normal gradient calculation
interpolationSchemes defines how values are interpolated from cell centres to face centres
limitedLinear is a bounded divergence scheme limiter

prompt: Write a technical report on mesh generation and validation in OpenFOAM, covering blockMesh usage, block and grading definitions, mesh quality checks, face validity constraints, and how mesh data is stored on disk.
must_include_facts: blockMeshDict defines the mesh topology with vertices, blocks, edges, and boundary patches
Grading controls the expansion ratio of cells along block edges
maxNonOrtho keyword controls non-orthogonality checking during mesh validation
Face validity requires that face area vectors point outward from the cell
Point, face, and cell data files are stored in the constant/polyMesh directory
relevant_sections: 5.3 Mesh generation with the blockMesh utility

prompt: Write a comprehensive report on boundary conditions in OpenFOAM, covering patch types, the difference between wall and patch, empty and wedge patches for 2D cases, cyclic boundaries and jump conditions, fixedFluxPressure, and traction boundary conditions.
must_include_facts: The empty patch type is used for directions in which no solution is required in 2D cases
The wedge patch type is used for 2D axisymmetric simulations with a wedge-shaped geometry
Wall boundaries apply no-slip conditions by default for velocity
A patch is a generic boundary type that does not contain geometric or topological information
Jump conditions at cyclic boundaries can specify a pressure drop across the interface
fixedFluxPressure adjusts the pressure gradient to match the velocity flux at the boundary
Traction boundary condition specifies stress components on the boundary for solid mechanics

prompt: Write a technical report on solution algorithms in OpenFOAM, comparing SIMPLE and PIMPLE for pressure-velocity coupling, describing the fvSolution dictionary structure, under-relaxation factors, and linear solver configuration.
must_include_facts: SIMPLE is a steady-state pressure-velocity coupling algorithm
PIMPLE combines PISO and SIMPLE for transient simulations with outer correction loops
Under-relaxation factors in fvSolution control how aggressively fields are updated each iteration
The solvers sub-dictionary in fvSolution specifies the linear solver for each field variable
fvSolution is located in the system directory

prompt: Write a technical report on parallel execution and reconstruction in OpenFOAM, covering domain decomposition methods, running applications with MPI, the reconstructPar and reconstructParMesh utilities, and post-processing decomposed cases.
must_include_facts: decomposePar divides the mesh and fields across processor directories
mpirun -np <N> is used to launch parallel OpenFOAM applications
reconstructPar reassembles decomposed time directories into the original case structure
reconstructParMesh reconstructs only the mesh without field data
Individual processor directories can be post-processed independently without reconstruction
relevant_sections: 3.4.1 Decomposition of mesh and initial field data

prompt: Write a technical report on post-processing and data extraction in OpenFOAM, covering the sampling library, probes, the foamPostProcess utility, available sampling types, and graph/line data extraction.
must_include_facts: The sampling library extracts field data at specified locations during or after simulation
Probes record field values at specified point locations over time
foamPostProcess executes function objects on existing case data without re-running the solver
Sampling types include uniform, face, midPoint, and points
Graph data can be extracted along lines or curves for plotting

prompt: Write a technical report on tensor mathematics and field operations in OpenFOAM, covering the tensor rank system, scalar/vector/tensor fields, gradient/divergence/Laplacian operators in the C++ API, and the volField template class.
must_include_facts: OpenFOAM represents tensors from rank 0 (scalar) through rank 3
A symmetric rank 2 tensor has 6 independent components
The fvc namespace provides explicit finite volume calculus operations like gradient and divergence
volScalarField and volVectorField are typedefs of GeometricField templated on the mesh type
The gradient operator maps a scalar field to a vector field

prompt: Write a technical report on OpenFOAM case structure and runtime configuration, covering the case directory layout, controlDict parameters, runtime modifiable dictionaries, library loading, dictionary keyword lookup, file format conventions, and solver output interpretation.
must_include_facts: An OpenFOAM case has three required directories: 0 (initial conditions), constant, and system
controlDict specifies start/end time, time step, write interval, and output format
runTimeModifiable allows dictionaries to be re-read during a simulation without restarting
The libs entry in controlDict loads additional shared libraries at runtime
OpenFOAM defaults to ASCII file format for data files
Ux_0 and UxFinalRes represent initial and final residuals for velocity field solving

prompt: Write a technical report on multiphase and specialized solvers in OpenFOAM, covering the Volume of Fluid method, VoFSolver base class, interface capturing, the setFields utility for initialization, and combustion utilities.
must_include_facts: The Volume of Fluid method uses a scalar indicator field (alpha) ranging from 0 to 1
VoFSolver serves as the base class for solvers handling immiscible fluid interfaces
Interface capturing reconstructs the sharp interface from the smooth alpha field
setFields initializes fields based on geometric regions defined via topoSetSource
equilibriumFlameT calculates equilibrium flame temperatures for combustion cases

prompt: Write a technical report on the OpenFOAM build system and source code organization, covering the wmake build system, the difference between exe and libso compilation, header file conventions, the project directory structure, SI units, and the Courant number.
must_include_facts: wmake is the standard compilation tool for OpenFOAM applications and libraries
exe compiles an executable binary while libso compiles a shared library (.so file)
.H header files contain class declarations and are included by .C source files
The WM_PROJECT_DIR environment variable points to the OpenFOAM installation directory
OpenFOAM uses SI base units: kilogram, metre, second, Kelvin, mole, ampere, candela
The Courant number Co = delta_t * |U| / delta_x must remain below 1 for explicit time stepping
